page.description:
A key function of a database management system is the ability to select specific records and put them in a particular order. Ordering records puts them in a specified sequence, like ordering last names alphabetically. Ordering is also referred to as sorting.
Alpha Anywhere provides a variety of tools for finding, selecting, and ordering records. You can perform powerful and complex searches to group your data into lists that match your specific criteria.

case.title: Ascending Sort
case.description: quickly perform a single field sort

case.title: Descending Sort
case.description: quickly perform a single field sort

case.title: Quick Filter
case.description: quickly display the set of records that match a field value

case.title: Quick Filter (Exclude)
case.description: quickly display the set of records that do not match a field value

case.title: Quick Filter For...
case.description: quickly display the set of records that do match any value

case.title: Multi Field Quick Filter
case.description: quickly display the set of records that match several field values

case.title: Find by Key
case.description: quickly display the first record that matches an index value

case.title: Find Text
case.description: search for text in one or more fields

case.title: Find by Form
case.description: quickly display the set of records that match several field values
